IRON.function: Carries oxygen in red blood cells, supports metabolism and immune function.
IRON.why: Iron is a component of hemoglobin and myoglobin, crucial for oxygen transport and muscle function. It also supports enzyme activity and immunity.

VITAMIN D.function: Regulates calcium absorption, supports immune system, and maintains healthy bones and mood.
VITAMIN D.why: Vitamin D helps regulate calcium and phosphorus levels, which are essential for strong bones. It also modulates immune responses and influences mood regulation.

B12.function: Supports nerve function, DNA synthesis, red blood cell production, and brain health.
B12.why: Vitamin B12 is required for neurological function and forming red blood cells. Its deficiency can lead to irreversible nerve damage if untreated.

MAGNESIUM.function: Regulates muscle and nerve function, blood pressure, glucose control, and protein synthesis.
MAGNESIUM.why: Magnesium acts as a cofactor in over 300 enzyme systems and is crucial for energy production, nervous system balance, and muscle relaxation.

ZINC.function: Supports immune defense, cell division, wound healing, and DNA synthesis.
ZINC.why: Zinc is needed for enzyme function, protein synthesis, and immunity. Its deficiency impairs growth and infection resistance.

VITAMIN A.function: Promotes vision, immune function, reproduction, and cell growth.
VITAMIN A.why: Vitamin A maintains epithelial cells and mucous membranes. It is critical for eye health, immune defense, and fetal development.

FOLATE.function: Essential for DNA synthesis, red blood cell production, and during pregnancy for fetal development.
FOLATE.why: Folate helps form and repair DNA and RNA. It prevents neural tube defects in pregnancy and supports heart health.

CALCIUM.function: Strengthens bones and teeth, supports nerve signaling, muscle contraction, and blood clotting.
CALCIUM.why: Calcium is stored in bones and used to maintain bone density. It also plays a critical role in heart and muscle contractions.

IODINE.function: Needed for thyroid hormone production, metabolism regulation, and cognitive function.
IODINE.why: Iodine is essential for synthesizing thyroid hormones that control metabolism, brain development, and temperature regulation.

OMEGA-3.function: Reduces inflammation, supports heart and brain health, and improves mood and vision.
OMEGA-3.why: Omega-3s are essential fatty acids that regulate inflammation, build cell membranes in the brain, and support cardiovascular health.
